reviews.review_msg: PHYS 121 is a HARD class but Haljan makes it so much more bearable. He's incredibly accessible and is super engaging in lectures, and I actually enjoyed attending them. You can also tell he knows what he's doing. If physics isn't your thing, take a class with him!

Best physics Prof I've ever had. His lectures are really clear with lots of examples so I would recommend going as it makes the material much easier to understand. The exams are hard but very reasonable compared to some other physics exams I've taken. 100% want him to teach all my science courses.

Extremely amazing prof and one of the more caring ones. He gets really excited during demos and whenever people get iclicker questions right. Would definitely recommend to people taking a physics class!

Great professor. I had heard nightmares about E&M physics but Paul made it a very clear and reasonable experience. Most fair midterms I've ever seen from a class, highly resembling the homework with the odd challenge. Used SmartPhysics which, unlike mastering physics, is actually useful. If i had to take more physics Id definitely take em with Paul
Awesome prof and will answer all your questions.

Nice prof! Polite and clear. To my surprise for this course you got problems solved in lectures not tutorials.  i clicker questions are important since some of the exam problems are based on them.  Smart physics sucks, you just get judged wrong by the system. Though before every lecture haljan will show comments, most of them are quite funny :)

He is the most huggable person you will meet. I had to resist the temptation of standing up mid lectures and give him a hug multiple times and Im a straight dude. He uses alot of demos in his lectures and gets way too exited about them. Very challenging assignment but the tests are fair. Overall very fun course, wold strongly recommend
He's cool :D
He is a great professor and good at relating material in class to current real world applications.

Dr. Haljan strikes me as someone who never lost the excitement from middle school when they first find out that lasers are a real thing. He is enthusiastic, moreso than I've seen from any other professors at SFU so far. It is contagious and made this course an absolute pleasure.  PHYS 255 when he next teaches it, even though it's not needed for me

Absolutely fantastic prof. He may seem a little nervous, but he's a pleasure to talk to. Genuinely interested in the subject and willing to help you out, but won't give you the answers. Tests are extremely fair. Great lectures and tough but interesting assignments. I wish he taught more upper level courses - I'd definitely love to have him again.

Very friendly, soft spoken professor. His lecture notes (power points and tutorial assignments) were great as a reference. Pay attention to those iClicker questions! Midterms and final was fair - all relevant to what we learned in class. Some concepts were hard for me personally, but if you're familiar with physics, you'll probably find it easy.

This class was quite demanding, but he kept the lectures very interesting (lots of demos) and his explanations were clear. Provides very well organized lecture notes, encourages questions. Very enjoyable class.
He's great, he may seem nervous at first but I thought he was pretty good at explaining and his applications of experiments was cool. He made the course more interesting than it really is.

I loved this Dr Haljan. He's hilarious and tried to make every class fun by doing a lot of live demonstrations! He's kind of a strange man yet charismatic and he chuckles at everything and gets really excited when he does the in class demonstrations. The iClicker questions in class are usually easy and he's pretty clear when he speaks. Great prof.
he can not teach
He's cute.great prof
Great Prof

Nervous little guy.   Does his part to make sure the students have the material i.e. prints out his notes for the class as well as posts them online (extra writing and all). Style: demonstrate first (if possible) explane later.  Not very helpful with homework, prefers the discovery method rather than spoonfeeding.  Interesting prof to have had.

Good prof, I enjoyed his classes quite. His approach tends to be experiment focused (we did experiments in tutorial and he encouraged us to play with things) which I though was great. He expects you to try and figure things out on your own, but if you can't get it, he offers tons of support. Great prof for anyone interested in learning physics.
Much better than Mike Hayden is all i've got to say. Most people think Mike Hayden is god, but I liked Paul more.

For a nervous little man, Professor Haljan gives a pretty good lecture. He doesn't have the command presence of some profs, so other students tend to chat away freely while he's lecturing, but he provides printed notes that mirror his teaching slides, and he presents the material in a clear and informative way.
We asked him a homework question, he told us "the best way to learn is to discuss it among yourselves" and walked away...good prof, i don't think so!
Terrible Teacher, just there to do research. Uselss
This guy CANNOT teach

If my memory serves me right, this course was brutal. Very hard. The course is now renamed PHYS 421 to better reflect the difficulty level. There are other profs who will make this course a little bit easier.

Extremely approachable and easy to relate to. Cares a lot about taking the time to help students learn and provides valuable feedback on reports. Gives numerous applications/examples/context in which what we are learning may be useful. Time consuming couse, but learned lots while having fun!
